name: Ooty Botanical Gardens
highlights: Terraced layout with more than 650 species
Italian Garden laid by WWI Italian prisoners
Fossilized tree trunk estimated to be 20 million years old
Conservatory with various flowering plants
Nurseries for exotic plants
annualVisitors: At least 1.5 lakh during the Flower Show
design: Lower Garden: Featuring a map of India with plants and a 20 million-year-old fossil trunk.
New Garden: Houses a rose garden with various hybrid roses.
Italian Garden: Perennial flowers and a typical Italian layout.
Nurseries: Breeds exotic plants with glass houses.

name: Ooty Rose Garden
activities: Exploring various rose species, Photography, Observing the Flower Show in May
highlights: Home to over 20,000 varieties of roses including Hybrid Tea Roses, Floribunda, and Miniature Roses.
Awarded as the ‘Garden of Excellence’ by the World Federation of Rose Societies.
Features terraces adorned with rose shrubs and other flowering plants.
bestTimeToVisit: March to June for the full bloom and May for the Flower Show
tips: Unexpected rains common, carrying an umbrella recommended.

name: Nilgiri Mountain Railway
timings: First train from Mettupalayam at 7:10 AM, Last train from Ooty at 2:00 PM
activities: Scenic train ride through Nilgiri Hills, Experience heritage steam locomotives, Explore stations like Coonoor, Wellington, Lovedale
highlights: UNESCO World Heritage Site
Operates on a unique rack and pinion system
Covers Mettupalayam, Kellar, Coonoor, Wellington, Lovedale, and Ootacamund
Passes through 16 tunnels, 208 curves, and 250 bridges
Offers spectacular views of tea plantations, forests, and Nilgiri Hills
tips: Book tickets in advance especially during peak season
No washrooms on the train, plan accordingly
Follow all guidelines provided by the railway authority

name: Tamilnadu Tourism Boat House
activities: Boating with options like pedal boats, rowboats, motorboats
Mini garden with amusement park for children
7D cinema, horror house, mirror house, Columbus ride, and dashing cars
highlights: Situated approximately 1km from the bus station and railway station
Constructed by John Sullivan in 1824
Covers an area of 65 acres
Operated by Tamil Nadu Tourism Development Corporation since 1973

name: Mudumalai Tiger Reserve
location: NH 67, Gudalur, Devarshola, Tamil Nadu, 643223, India

floraFauna.flora: Tropical Moist Deciduous, Tropical Dry Deciduous and Southern Tropical Thorn forest
floraFauna.fauna: Tigers, Dhole, Asian Elephant, Gaur, Sambar, Spotted Deer, Indian Muntjac, Mouse Deer, Wild Boar, Leopard, Striped Hyena, Jackal, Sloth Bear, Bonnet Macaque, Langur, Giant Squirrel, Flying Squirrel, and over 227 species of birds

bestTimeToVisit: February to May and September to October

howToReach.byAir: Coimbatore Airport at Peelamedu (86.4 km away)
howToReach.byRoad: Mysore-Ooty road, 87 km from Mysore and 45 km from Ooty
howToReach.byCabTaxi: Cab from nearby cities, Price: INR 2800 approximately

name: Elk Hill Murugan Temple
highlights: Situated atop Elk Hill amidst picturesque backdrops
Houses a 40 feet tall statue of Lord Muruga
Ideal for meditation and yoga practices
Hosts the festival of Thaipusam with grand processions

howToReach.byAir: Nearest airport is Coimbatore International Airport, 87 km away
howToReach.byTrain: Mettupalayam Railway Station accessible via train, then board the Nilgiri Toy Train
howToReach.byBus: Well connected via government and luxury buses, easy access from Ooty Bus Stand

festival: Thaipusam celebrated with processions and offerings to Lord Muruga

name: Tea Factory & The Tea Museum
activities: Shopping for homemade chocolates and souvenirs
highlights: Spread across nearly an acre amidst emerald green tea plants
Offers insights into the origin and types of tea across the globe
Features a 40 feet tall statue of Lord Muruga
Hosts Thaipusam festival with grand processions

howToReach.byAir: Nearest airport is Coimbatore International Airport, 87 km away
howToReach.byTrain: Nearest railway station is Mettupalayam, then board the Nilgiri Toy Train
howToReach.byBus: Well connected via government and luxury buses, easy access from Ooty Bus Stand

name: Pykara Waterfalls
location: Near Pykara Dam, Ooty, Tamil Nadu
highlights: Consists of two majestic falls with heights of 55m and 61m
Surrounded by dense forests and situated downstream of Pykara Dam
Famous for Toda settlements nearby
Advised to carry warm clothes even during summer

howToReach.byAir: Nearest airport is Coimbatore, around 116 km away
howToReach.byTrain: Nearest railway station is in Ooty, around 23 km away
howToReach.byRoad: Accessible by bus or cab from Ooty

bestTimeToVisit: Post-monsoon season, avoiding monsoon months due to unpredictable water levels

name: Government Museum
location: Mysore road, Ooty, Tamil Nadu, India
timings: 10:00 AM - 5:00 PM, Closed on Fridays and Second Saturdays
highlights: Exhibits include tribal art, sculptures, and ecological details of Tamil Nadu.
Provides educational insights into the cultures and traditions of the region.
Hosts items from pre-independence era and artifacts of tribal communities.

howToReach.byAir: Nearest airport is Coimbatore International Airport, about 88 km away.
howToReach.byTrain: Ooty Railway Station, accessible by Nilgiri Mountain Railway.
howToReach.byRoad: Well connected via road; buses and taxis available from major cities.

name: Ketti Valley View Point
location: Between Ooty-Coonoor, Nilgiris District, Tamil Nadu, India
activities: Exploring nearby attractions such as Sim's Park, Thunder World, and Doddabetta Peak
Enjoying delicious food at local cafes
Exploring the sister lakes - Avalanche & Emerald
highlights: Known as the 'Switzerland of the Nilgiris' due to its lush greenery and picturesque landscape
Offers panoramic views of the largest valley in the Nilgiris and its surroundings
Home to several tribes, including Todas and Badagas
Popular among nature lovers and photographers
bestTimeToVisit: Summer season for a clear and pleasant view of the valley

howToReach.byAir: Coimbatore International Airport, then local transportation to Ooty
howToReach.byRoad: Well connected via road with local, private, and government buses available
howToReach.byTrain: Mettupalayam Railway Station, then toy train ride or hire a private vehicle to Ooty

name: Doddabetta Peak
location: Ooty - Kotagiri Road, Nilgiris District, Tamil Nadu, India
highlights: Highest point in the Nilgiri Mountains at 2,623 meters
Panoramic views of the landscape, valley, and plains
Telescope House managed by Tamil Nadu Tourism Development Corporation
Flora includes tall rhododendron trees, flowering sub-alpine shrubs, and herbs
Home to endangered species of flora and fauna

howToReach.byRoad: Buses and private taxis from Ooty
howToReach.trekkingDistance: Approximately 2 km trek from the base

name: Wenlock Downs 9th Mile Shooting Point
location: Ooty - Pykara Road, Tamil Nadu, India
highlights: Lush green meadows that stretch endlessly
Popular spot for film shooting
Offers breathtaking and unobstructed views of the Nilgiris

howToReach.byRoad: 15 km from Ooty, accessible by road from nearby cities like Bangalore, Coimbatore, and Mysore
howToReach.byRail: Nearest railway station is Mettupalayam; Ooty can be reached via the toy train from there
howToReach.byAir: Nearest airport is Coimbatore Airport, 88 km away

tips: Carry plenty of water and wear comfortable shoes for exploring
Consider visiting early to avoid crowds and for the best photography light

name: Karnataka Siri Horticulture Garden
location: Fern Hill, West Mere, Ooty, Tamil Nadu, 643006, India
highlights: Sprawling across 38 acres with Rose, Italian, Tea, Maze, Sunken, and Topiary Gardens
Home to a variety of colorful and vibrant flowers grown in 50,000 pots
Features orchids, herb sections, and a maple tree avenue
Hosts a winter flower show annually
howToReach: 3 km from Ooty Bus Stand and Railway Station, easily accessible via local transportation

name: Kandal Cross Shrine
description: Known as the 'Jerusalem of the East,' this church features a life-size bronze crucifix and a relic believed to be from Christ's cross. Sacred prayers are offered every Friday.
highlights: Life-size bronze crucifix
Relic from Christ's cross
Popular prayer location

name: Emerald Lake
location: Emerald Village, The Nilgiris, Ooty, Tamil Nadu, 623704, India
highlights: Serene picnic spot
Picturesque beauty
Home to a wide variety of flora and fauna
Ideal for solitude lovers

name: Ooty Golf Course
location: Near Wenlock Downs, Ooty, Tamil Nadu
specialFeatures: Surrounded by thick woods of eucalyptus, oak, rhododendron, and fir
accommodation: Club provides annex with ten rooms and six huts
